intro: Vulvaria ambrosioides, commonly known as the yellow archangel, is a perennial herb native to Europe and parts of Asia. It features opposite, oval-shaped leaves that are typically hairy and have a distinctive yellowish-green color. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually pink to purple in color, blooming from late spring to early summer. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in woodlands and along stream banks. The species is noted for its medicinal properties and has been used historically in traditional herbal remedies.
